Messages.Message: Student scores on the Latin Proficiency assessments are assigned to one of four achievement levels based on the scale score.

ReportAssessmentType.ClaimAchievementMessage: {0}'s results are also reported out into the five domains (i.e., areas) that together make up Latin proficiency: Translation, Grammer and Syntax, Reading Comprehension, Vocabulary and Listening and Speaking. To view a description of the student's achievement level claim (i.e., area), select either [Progressing], or [Well Developed] from the student-level selections available in the table below.

ReportPerformanceLevels.ReportPerformanceLevel: {0} did not meet the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework. claim.
{0} nearly met the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} has made progress and met the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} has made progress and exceeded the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
